title: Callum Hudson-Odoi and Reece James provide boost for England Under 21s as pair return
text:
England Under 21s have been boosted by the return of Reece James and Callum Hudson-Odoi from injury ahead of their upcoming European qualifiers.

The pair both missed out on the last squad through injury, but have been named among the 23-strong group for games against Slovenia and Austria this month.

England first travel to Maribor on October 11 to face the upcoming hosts of the U21 European Championship, before hosting Austria at Stadium:MK on October 15.

Callum Hudson-Odoi is back from injury and in the England Under 21s squad for upcoming ties

Reece James is another Chelsea starlet back in England U21s squad for this month's matches

Tottenham's young goalkeeper Brandon Austin has received his first call-up to the Under 21s following successful stints with the Under 19s and Under 20s. He is also eligible to play for the USA and represented them at Under 18s level.

Todd Cantwell, meanwhile, has received a second call-up after continuing to impress for Norwich in the Premier League.

Speaking after the announcement on Friday morning, boss Aidy Boothroyd said: 'After two good results in difficult and high-pressure games last month, we've kept the squad pretty consistent as they performed well.

'We have a few players back from injury in Callum Hudson-Odoi, Reece James and Lloyd Kelly and we're looking forward to getting back together again and we are building a strong core of players early on in the campaign.

Aidy Boothroyd is taking his side to Slovenia, before hosting Austria in Milton Keynes

Young Spurs stopper Brandon Austin has received a first call-up to the Under 21s squad

'The squad also has more playing minutes at club level than they might normally do at this stage of the season, which is great for us ahead of these matches.

'It will be a tough game in Slovenia, we are expecting a low block that will be a good test for our players against a different type of opponent. As they're one of the hosts of the next Euros, it's a great chance for us to experience playing there, as we work hard to qualify for the tournament.

'Austria sit on top of the qualifying group alongside us and they're a good, well-organised team and an emerging nation, so hopefully it will be an entertaining and competitive game for our supporters watching in Milton Keynes.'
description: The pair both missed out on the last squad through injury, but have been named among the 23-strong group for games against Slovenia and Austria later this month.
